page.title: 09More about our Churches
page.content: The roof is held up with big round stone pillars. There are three on each side. The oldest grave in the churchyard is from 1765. The font is round with patterns on.It is very old and made of stone. It is used for baptizing children. Behind it is a baptismal roll with all the babies names on. All Saints Church services are held on Holy Days and on Sundays at 8.00am., 10.00am.,and 6.30pm. The tower has six bells which are rung before a service to call people to church. The vicar reads The Bible from the lectern. He preaches his sermon from the pulpit. It is made of wood and is old. There is another smaller church of the same religion in Lower Penn.
